name: Thomas Kuhn
background: Philosopher and historian of science. Wrote 'The Structure of Scientific Revolutions'. Introduced paradigm shifts, normal science vs revolutionary science, incommensurability.

principles.name: Paradigm shifts are discontinuous
principles.description: Scientific progress isn't cumulative - it proceeds through revolutions that overthrow existing frameworks. Normal science operates within paradigms; revolutionary science replaces them.
principles.falsification: When change is genuinely incremental and paradigms evolve smoothly rather than being replaced

principles.name: Anomalies accumulate before revolution
principles.description: Paradigm shifts don't happen immediately when problems appear. Anomalies build up, get explained away, until critical mass triggers crisis and revolution.
principles.falsification: When single decisive experiments or discoveries immediately overturn existing views

principles.name: Different paradigms are incommensurable
principles.description: People in different paradigms literally see different things. Direct comparison is impossible because the standards of comparison are paradigm-dependent. Communication across paradigms is partial at best.
principles.falsification: When paradigms share enough common ground for productive dialogue and gradual convergence
